subject: Politics
title: Authoritarianism and Corruption
description: Learn Authoritarianism and Corruption in one minute.

hook.text: Dictators don't just seize power â€” they monetize it. Authoritarianism and corruption are natural partners.

buildup.text: Without free press, independent courts, or fair elections, nothing stops rulers from looting their own countries.

discovery.text: Mobutu stole up to $5 billion from Congo. Marcos looted the Philippines. The pattern repeats across dictatorships.

twist.text: Some autocracies cut petty corruption while enabling massive elite theft. Singapore is clean at the bottom but opaque.

climax.text: Corruption sustains autocracy. Leaders buy loyalty with stolen wealth. Remove the money and the regime crumbles.

punchline.text: Dictators need corruption to survive. Theft is the glue that holds power.

quiz.question: How does corruption sustain authoritarian regimes?
options: Leaders buy loyalty from key supporters using stolen public wealth
Corruption has no connection to authoritarian survival
Dictators eliminate all corruption to maintain power
